sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• ACE inhibitor-induced angioedema: 30 mg SUBQ (study dose)
  • Hereditary angioedema, Acute Attacks: 30 mg SUBQ over at least 30 seconds in the abdominal area; additional doses of 30 mg may be administered at intervals of at least 6 hours if attack persists or symptoms recur; MAX 90 mg/24 hours

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: Safety and effectiveness in patients below 18 years of age have not been established

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• Geriatric: No dosage adjustment is recommended
  • Renal impairment: No dosage adjustment is required
  • Hepatic impairment: No dosage adjustment is required

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Hereditary angioedema, Acute Attacks
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
ACE inhibitor-induced angioedema

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• airway obstruction during acute laryngeal attacks may occur; immediate medical attention required in addition to treatment with icatibant
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Icatibant: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Injection site reaction (97%)
  • Hepatic:ALT/SGPT level raised, AST/SGOT level raised
  • Neurologic:Dizziness (3%)
  • Other:Fever (4%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Icatibant is a bradykinin B2 receptor antagonist. It inhibits bradykinin from binding the bradykinin B2 receptor and therefore treats the symptoms of an acute hereditary angioedema attack.

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Renal excretion: inactive metabolites; less than 10% unchanged
  • Total body: 245 mL/min

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Subcutaneous
  • Use the provided 25 gauge needle, do not use a different needle
  • Administer SUBQ over at least 30 seconds into the abdomen

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: improvement in symptoms of acute attacks of hereditary angioedema is indicative of efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Warn patient to avoid activities requiring mental alertness or coordination until drug effects are realized as drug may cause tiredness, drowsiness, and dizziness.
  • Drug may cause injection-site reactions, pyrexia, and rash.
  • Advise patient using drug for acute laryngeal symptoms to seek immediate medical attention after administering drug.
  • Instruct patient that additional doses may be administered at intervals of at least 6 hours if symptoms recur or response is inadequate. Patient should not use more than 3 doses in 24 hours.
